success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant created a return (RMA) for the order placed on 2026-01-15 via create_return.

task.objective: Return an order that was delivered.

injected_behaviors.instructions: The user remembers ordering a special fountain pen and some classroom supplies around mid-January, but doesn't know the exact order_id. She may reference using the pen for grading papers and poetry annotations.

items.name: Rosewood Barrel Fountain Pen - Fine Nib
Recycled Composition Notebooks - 6 Pack, College Ruled
Warm LED Desk Lamp with Adjustable Arm
Class Set: "The Poet X" by Elizabeth Acevedo (Paperbacks, 5-Pack)

persona.name: Rachel Whitmore
persona.occupation: High School English and Creative Writing Teacher
persona.bio: Rachel Whitmore teaches English and creative writing at a public high school in Portland, where she sneaks poetry into almost everything—from grammar lessons to end-of-semester projects. With a master’s in educational psychology, she’s fascinated by how different students process text and loves helping reluctant readers find the one book that finally hooks them. Outside the classroom, she hosts a monthly poetry reading at a local café and tinkers with her own chapbook drafts late into the night.
persona.writing_style: warm, thoughtful, friendly conversational with occasional literary references and precise word choice
sample_messages: Could you send me the latest draft of the flyer for the poetry night? I’d like to tweak the wording a bit so it feels more inviting to first-time readers.
Just finished that novel you recommended—can we talk about that ending tomorrow? I have Thoughts, especially about how the narrator’s voice shifts in the last third.
Yes, that time works perfectly. I’ll bring the annotated articles and a couple of poems that illustrate different approaches to metaphor, so we’ll have concrete examples to work from.

messages.output_raw: Hi—yes, I’m trying to return an order that was delivered recently. It’s the one with a special fountain pen in it.

steps.output_raw:
<think>
</think>
<plan>
1. Ask the user for identifying details (order id or email/zip/last4) so I can locate the correct order.
2. Use the order lookup tool to find the order.
3. Retrieve full order details and determine which items are return-eligible.
4. Walk the user through selecting items, method, and reason; get a refund estimate.
5. Create the return and share the confirmation and next steps.
</plan>
<action type="say">
I can help with that. I’ll first need to locate the order and then check what’s eligible to return.

1. Do you know the order ID for the fountain-pen order? If yes, please paste it here.
2. If not, I can look it up—please provide:
   - The email you used for the purchase
   - The shipping ZIP/postal code
   - (Optional but helpful) Last 4 digits of the card you paid with

Also, was the fountain pen the only item in that order, or were there other items you might want to return too?</action>

<action type="say">
Your fountain pen is eligible for return by dropoff, with no restocking fee, and it needs to be returned by 2026-02-18.

Here are nearby dropoff options for ZIP 97205:
1) Parcel Drop Hub - Goose Hollow (LOC-103)  
   2100 SW Madison St, Portland, OR 97205  
   Hours: Mon-Sun 7am-10pm  

2) UPS Store - SW Jefferson (LOC-102)  
   555 SW Jefferson St, Portland, OR 97201  
   Hours: Mon-Fri 8am-6pm, Sat 9am-3pm  

3) USPS - Downtown Portland Station (LOC-101)  
   730 NW 14th Ave, Portland, OR 97209  
   Hours: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm, Sat 10am-2pm  

Two quick things so I can finalize the return:

1) Which dropoff location do you want to use? (You can answer with LOC-103, LOC-102, or LOC-101.)  
2) What’s the reason for the return for the pen? Pick one of:
   - Damaged or defective  
   - Item not as described  
   - Ordered by mistake  
   - Changed mind  
   - Received late  
   - Other (briefly describe)</action>

steps.output_raw:
<think>
I have a successful return creation with RMA details, label URL, QR token, and refund estimate. The user just needs a concise summary plus what to do next. I’ll give them the confirmation, refund info, and clear dropoff steps, keeping it short and practical.
</think>
<plan>
1. Summarize the return details (RMA, item, location, refund estimate) and give clear next steps for dropoff and tracking.
</plan>
<action type="say">
You’re all set—your return for the fountain pen is created.

Here are the details:
- Return ID (RMA): RMA-774203  
- Item: Rosewood Barrel Fountain Pen - Fine Nib (qty 1)  
- Dropoff location: Parcel Drop Hub - Goose Hollow  
  2100 SW Madison St, Portland, OR 97205  
- Refund estimate: $54.99 USD to your original payment method  
  - Expected timing: 3–7 business days after the carrier scans your return

How to complete the return:
1) Pack the pen securely (original packaging if possible).  
2) Either:
   - Print and use this label: https://returns.example.com/labels/RMA-774203.pdf  
   - Or use the QR code at the counter: QR-RET-9f3c72b1c6084e1ab2b7d9b8e4a1c5f2  
3) Drop it off at Parcel Drop Hub - Goose Hollow within the next 10 days, and keep your dropoff receipt.

If you’d like, I can also give you a short reference message you can save noting the RMA and what’s being returned.</action>
